title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 7 april [1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 7 April [1868]
text: See End letter —Brooklyn—1868 (?) impeachment of Johnson '68aprilApril 7 My dear waltWaltwe are having an awful rain storm and georgeGeorgey is laying on his oars to day i tell him i should pray for raineyrainy days if i was him he is the inspector of the cementing part there has been much trouble about that part of the work the pipes have leaked and made much trouble georgesGeorge's work is not hard but dirty as he has to get down in the dichditch to see to it he sent one man away on his own responcibiltelyresponsibility as he didentdidn't doodo the work good bergenBergen is on that department too)well walterWalter i got your letter to day with the money and i got the one on the third with the money order i went down to the post office and got the money all very good i had owed amermanAmerman for a barrellbarrel of flour for some time so i gave georgeGeorge 10 dolldollars and he paid the balance 16 dodollars was the amount so i feel releivedrelieved of that debt ammermanAmerman is advertised to sell out and i wanted to pay him before he left and sent the accounaccount we remain all about the same as when i last wrote to you walterWalter i think i feel better to day than i have for some time i have been troubled with the dissinessdizziness in my head but to day i feel intirelyentirely free from it have you been troubled with your old complaint walterWalter in your head you say you have had a bad couldcold i was in hopes you wouldentwouldn't be troubled with it again maryMary used to be troubled very much with that complaint she says she dontdon't have it at all now i asked her what helped her she said hops steemedsteamed and put on her face was all that cured her i have not heard from maryMary since she went away nor hannHannah either for all she promised to write often to me i wish she would it would make her feel better i make no doubt i dontdon't know what i would doodo if i didentdidn't get any letters) i have read the impeachment articles every day i was in hopes it would be carried through without any postponement i never had any idea butlerButler was so smart i suppose the others is smart but he seems to fetch them up so quick) i have not had any letter from jeffJeff or mattyMatty since i wrote to you good bie waltWalt dear Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 7 April [1868]
